description.value:
You cause your magic to create a full picture through numerous, smaller details, where tiny shapes form an illusion that trick the senses into believing a visible threat and leaving the true spell unseen.

For the duration, your spells are veiled and gain the illusion trait, though the intent of the spell is still apparent to any observer; a fireball would still appear as an eruption of harmful magic, or an electric ray might seem to be taking a meandering way to reach its target. Prior to resolving the outcome of a spell against affected creatures, determine if the targets disbelieve the veiled spell based on their perception. If the spell requires a spell attack, compare the outcome of the roll to a creature’s Perception DC. If it requires a saving throw, targeted creatures need to make a Seek check before rolling their saving throw.

If a creature fails to disbelieve the illusion, they take a -2 status penalty to their AC or saving throw against the spell. If they critically succeed in disbelieving the illusion, they gain a +1 status bonus instead.

@UUID[Compendium.immortal-ardor.classes.7V6zfl6anbjhvHNX]{Spell Effect: Stippling Shades}

Heightened (4th) The duration of this spell increases to 2 rounds.

Heightened (8th) Even if you fail to overcome a target’s Perception DC or if they only succeed (but not critically succeed) in their Seek attempt, the target still takes a -1 status penalty to their AC or saving throws against the spell.
